com.sri.ai.util.concurrent

Class BranchAndMerge

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.util.concurrent.BranchAndMerge

  • @Beta
public class BranchAndMerge
extends java.lang.Object
    A general purpose utility service for simplifying performing concurrent execution of work that can be split into sub-tasks or into smaller pieces recursively (i.e. very similar to JDK 7's Fork/Join ExecutorService concept but without explicitly detailing the mechanism - Note: may switch to using this internally in a later iteration).
    Author:
    oreilly

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  BranchAndMerge.Result<T>
      The result of branching and then merging the results from a collection of Callables.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BranchAndMerge

        public BranchAndMerge()

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        Reset the shared Branch and Merge Utility service (i.e. drop and reset up any worker threads it is configured to use.). Note: Only call this method at a safe point in your logic (i.e. when no other thread should be using this service).

      • execute

        public static <V> BranchAndMerge.Result<java.util.List<V>> execute(java.util.List<? extends java.util.concurrent.Callable<V>> tasks)
        Branch and merge call, the results from calling a list of tasks are collected into a list (order of results match those of the tasks).
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the results.
        Parameters:
        tasks - a list of tasks that are to be branched.
        Returns:
        a list of the results returned by the branched tasks. The ordering of the results will correspond to the ordering of the tasks that generated them (null results are allowed, either intentionally or due to a failure when calling a task).

      • execute

        public static <V> BranchAndMerge.Result<java.util.List<V>> execute(java.util.List<? extends java.util.concurrent.Callable<V>> tasks,
                                                                   com.google.common.base.Predicate<V> cancelOutstandingOnSuccess)
        Branch and merge call, the results from calling a list of tasks are collected into a list (order of results match those of the tasks).
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the results.
        Parameters:
        tasks - a list of tasks that are to be branched.
        cancelOutstandingOnSuccess - a predicate that returns true if all other outstanding tasks should be cancelled if a task returns a specified success value (i.e. can be used for short circuiting logic - e.g. when dealing with conjunctions or disjunctions of tasks).
        Returns:
        a list of the results returned by the branched tasks. The ordering of the results will correspond to the ordering of the tasks that generated them (null results are allowed, either intentionally or due to a failure when calling a task).

      • execute

        public static <V> BranchAndMerge.Result<java.util.List<V>> execute(java.util.List<? extends java.util.concurrent.Callable<V>> tasks,
                                                                   com.google.common.base.Predicate<V> cancelOutstandingOnSuccess,
                                                                   com.google.common.base.Predicate<java.lang.Throwable> cancelOutstandingOnFailure)
        Branch and merge call, the results from calling a list of tasks are collected into a list (order of results match those of the tasks).
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the results.
        Parameters:
        tasks - a list of tasks that are to be branched.
        cancelOutstandingOnSuccess - a predicate that returns true if all other outstanding tasks should be cancelled if a task returns a specified success value (i.e. can be used for short circuiting logic - e.g. when dealing with conjunctions or disjunctions of tasks).
        cancelOutstandingOnFailure - a predicate that returns true if all outstanding tasks should be cancelled if an failure occurs when executing one of the tasks.
        Returns:
        a list of the results returned by the branched tasks. The ordering of the results will correspond to the ordering of the tasks that generated them (null results are allowed, either intentionally or due to a failure when calling a task).

      • execute

        public static <V,T> BranchAndMerge.Result<T> execute(java.util.List<? extends java.util.concurrent.Callable<V>> tasks,
                                                     com.google.common.base.Function<java.util.List<V>,T> transformResults)
        Branch and merge call, the results from calling a list of tasks are passed thru to a transformation function that will create a desired merge result for the call.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the result.
        T - the type of the transformed result.
        Parameters:
        tasks - a list of tasks that are to be branched.
        transformResults - a function that will be called with a list of all of the results returned by the branched tasks (order will match that of the tasks themselves). This function should be able to handle null results as these can be legal, either intentionally returned by the task or as the result of a failure when calling the task.
        Returns:
        the result returned from applying transformResults on the list of results collected from the branched tasks.

      • execute

        public static <V,T> BranchAndMerge.Result<T> execute(java.util.List<? extends java.util.concurrent.Callable<V>> tasks,
                                                     com.google.common.base.Predicate<V> cancelOutstandingOnSuccess,
                                                     com.google.common.base.Function<java.util.List<V>,T> transformResults)
        Branch and merge call, the results from calling a list of tasks are passed thru to a transformation function that will create a desired merge result for the call.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the result.
        T - the type of the transformed result.
        Parameters:
        tasks - a list of tasks that are to be branched.
        cancelOutstandingOnSuccess - a predicate that returns true if all other outstanding tasks should be cancelled if a task returns a specified success value (i.e. can be used for short circuiting logic - e.g. when dealing with conjunctions or disjunctions of tasks).
        transformResults - a function that will be called with a list of all of the results returned by the branched tasks (order will match that of the tasks themselves). This function should be able to handle null results as these can be legal, either intentionally returned by the task or as the result of a failure when calling the task.
        Returns:
        the result returned from applying transformResults on the list of results collected from the branched tasks.

      • execute

        public static <V,T> BranchAndMerge.Result<T> execute(java.util.List<? extends java.util.concurrent.Callable<V>> tasks,
                                                     com.google.common.base.Predicate<V> cancelOutstandingOnSuccess,
                                                     com.google.common.base.Predicate<java.lang.Throwable> cancelOutstandingOnFailure,
                                                     com.google.common.base.Function<java.util.List<V>,T> transformResults)
        Branch and merge call, the results from calling a list of tasks are passed thru to a transformation function that will create a desired merge result for the call.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the result.
        T - the type of the transformed result.
        Parameters:
        tasks - a list of tasks that are to be branched.
        cancelOutstandingOnSuccess - a predicate that returns true if all other outstanding tasks should be cancelled if a task returns a specified success value (i.e. can be used for short circuiting logic - e.g. when dealing with conjunctions or disjunctions of tasks).
        cancelOutstandingOnFailure - a predicate that returns true if all outstanding tasks should be cancelled if an failure occurs when executing one of the tasks.
        transformResults - a function that will be called with a list of all of the results returned by the branched tasks (order will match that of the tasks themselves). This function should be able to handle null results as these can be legal, either intentionally returned by the task or as the result of a failure when calling the task.
        Returns:
        the result returned from applying transformResults on the list of results collected from the branched tasks.
